revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Belkin |model=F5D8231-4 |revision=v2000 |asin= |fcc_date=10/17/2006 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=K7SF5D8231-4B |ic_id=3632A-F5D82314 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.2 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F5181 |cpu1_cspeed=500 |fla1=4 |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |ram1=32 |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_minipci_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=SerComm YBW10A |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8361P;88W8361P-BEM1; |wi1_chip2_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip2_model=88W8060 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6061 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |default_user= |default_pass= |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|N1 Wireless Router}} :{{SupportPage|vendor=Belkin|vs_id_old=322}} The FCC test report lists the processor as a 333MHz Marvell 88F5180n, :RAM as 32MB, Flash as 4MB, and switch as the Marvell 88E6061. The wireless module has "970YBW0000-1.0MM" silkscreened on it in the FCC photos.
As shipped, the wireless module is a [[SerComm]] device, board ID YBW10A-1.0MM. :This mini PCI card has device ID [11ab:2a02]. Assumed 2x3 MIMO configuration. Then native software also allows this device to be easily configured :as a simple Wireless Access Point and Ethernet Switch, without :the routing and firewall services. *[https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=24356 On the '''OpenWrt''' forums] :- boot log, states CPU is a 88F5181 running at 500MHz. There does not appear to be any port of OpenWRT and such to the F5D8231-4 v2, :but the mini PCI card might be re-purposed, to convert an old notebook computer :to wireless N, leaving the center receive-only antenna connector open. Native Windows device drivers can be found at [http://sciencespaces.com/search/PCI%5CVEN_11AB--ds--DEV_2A02/3/ Sciencspaces]. :While no native Linux driver ever made it all the way into the mainstream kernel, :the card will also work with the Linux [http://ndiswrapper.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Belkin_F5D8001v2 ndiswrapper].
